Reviews.Title: “Convenient to downtown”
Reviews.Author: dberk
Reviews.Content: The property provided an average stay, the rooms were clean and the staff was very nice, however hotel is older and rooms could use some updating with some of the furniture. The cookies were hot and fresh, as usual. Balconies are nice with great views of the harbor and downtown areas, proximity to freeway and downtown area provide alot of traffic noise when the doors are open.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible property! How can Hilton put their name on this?”
Reviews.Author: dlabrake
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I'm a big fan of Hilton. Usually, the Hilton name, regardless of the type of brand that falls under their umbrella means you will have a quality stay. This is not the case with this property. I have never heard such dreadful sounds come out of pipes all night long. The sound was so loud, even when the bathroom door was shut it woke me up no less than 6-7 times throughout the night. Three nights in a row. I had read previous posts about this but I had also read positive posts that never mentioned it so I thought I would give them a try. Afterall, it is a Hilton property, how bad could it be? The walls are so thin you can hear the conversations in the room next to you. Not just noise...but the actual conversation. This past weekend the hotel was pretty full so you couldn't switch rooms. The guests on one side of me were out for a good part of the night and when they got back to their room, they stayed up talking. Not partying, just talking. You should be allowed to talk in your room, afterall you paid for it, right? I had to ask them several times to stop at 3am, 4am and 5am because I needed my sleep. This took place three nights in a row. I never left a hotel so tired. The decor is average, the lobby is very modern and the shuttle service was just ok. I asked for a 6am ride to the airport the night before and I was told they would be ready at 6am for me. It was actually 6:15 when they were ready. You may want to allow yourself a little extra time. The shuttle drivers were very friendly and apologized for not being ready at 6am. The property had a dining area and a gift shop as well as a pool and jacuzzi. All were very good. Overall, I base a hotel on cleanliness and sleep quality. This property FAILED the sleep quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Parking Garage”
Reviews.Author: janaki d
Reviews.Content: Do not even attempt to park an SUV in their garage. They won't tell you but their garage is not meant for SUV's. The Manager on duty herself has damaged her car 3 times. 4 other employees told me that people damage their cars all the time. You have to do a 5 point turn just to make it around the corner and up/down the ramps. All the employees that I met with stated that people with SUV's should not use their garage. They only told me that after the fact when they should warn their guests ahead of time and give them the option in taking the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Walking Location Hotel, Tight Parking Garage”
Reviews.Author: OpEd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for just two nights, but it was a great stay. Typical DoubleTree amenities and room type and my room happened to have a view of the Gas Lamp district (the other side is the freeway) and a small balcony. The bed was very comfy and I never heard a peep from neighboring rooms. Because I was in all day meetings I never made it to the restaurant, but the bar area did seem busy when I passed through. The only down side was the parking garage. In addition to being $24/night, it is the narrowest, tightest garage I've been in in a long time. I was driving a compact rental and could barely make the turn to get out without scraping the car along the ramp. There are plenty of paint streaks showing that many folks never made it. If you need a car while you're in town, you might want to skip this hotel if only because it will cost you a fortune in body work to get it in and out. The hotel is GREAT if you're planning to walk to all the restaurants and other things happening downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average, not up to Hilton Stds.”
Reviews.Author: Jimriver
Reviews.Content: Ms. Clapper in guest relations: see following: Room not cleaned until I called and compalined 3:34 pm when I retuned to my room....only 3 towels left in room daily for two people in a two rm. suite? I lost a button on a shirt and when asked if there was A simple sewing kit that most hotels give FREE I was told they sell them in the gift store for $7.99.....is mgt. serious ? No newspapers to buy in the gift store....other than than the US today free paper given out, with nothing available on Sundays...why not sell a nationally recognized paper from Calf., So people can keep up with the events of the day in a little detail? Housekeeping fair at most....sometimes the entire two room suite was NOT cleaned, just bath and bedrm. in the a.m. No coffee station to get just a free coffee to go or even buy a coffee to go, Except waiting in line at the restuarant to pay$2......next time I'll stay at a Hampton inn. In general very mediocre hotel....not worth the price! I

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff at this updated hotel”
Reviews.Author: PotatoMasher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from Broadway/Gas Lamp and Little Italy, but very nice and has great views from the balconies. I stayed for a work conference and it was great for me. Nice breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls Kept Us Up in the Middle of the Night”
Reviews.Author: JOL949
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Doubletree over the weekend, and here were our thoughts: The Good Price - we got the hotel via Priceline and were satisfied with the price (although parking was $22!) Staff - the staff were friendly and helpful. The cookies were quite the treat. The Okay Location - on the outskirts of downtown San Diego - it is a 15 minute walk into the Gaslamp District. However, you do walk by some seedier parts of downtown to get to the Gaslamp, so in the evening, we ended up taking a cab back to the hotel rather than walking. Parking Garage - as most people have already pointed out, the garage has extremely tight turns. I drive a Toyota Prius, so it wasn't as big a problem. However, I am not sure how people with larger cars, SUV's, trucks, etc. can get around those tight corners. Also, parking is expensive at $22/night, although you do get in and out privileges. Bathroom - there was something weird going on with the plumbing, because whenever you used the sink, the drain in the bathtub would start making funny noises. The hotel is clearly older, although they have done well to refurbish the decor of the rooms. Bad Thin Walls - we were awoken at 2am in the morning (and my wife was kept awake for the next hour or two) by (a) people in the hallway coming back from a night of drinking, (b) our neighbor's alarm clock going off for 30 minutes, (c) our neighbor watching TV at God-awful volumes, (d) our neighbors having a drunken argument, and (e) someone in the next room vomiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: nkcanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the hotel located 10 minutes from the airport while passing through. We were traveling with two adults, a child and infant, and found this to be ideal for us. Upon arrival, we were upgraded free of charge to a 1 bedroom suite with bunk beds and two queen beds. The extra space was ideal for traveling with an infant. Cookies were complimentary upon arrival as well, which made this my son's new favourite place. Breakfast on site at an affordable price and was delicious. Outdoor pool heated to a comfortable temperature to swim In the morning (16 degrees outside) with hot tub and fireplace. Would definetely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveinent, Clean, but oh the garage.”
Reviews.Author: microsciences
Reviews.Content: I like San Diego - A lot. Its worth a 10 point decrease on the blood pressure meter to me when I visit. The people are friendly, The streets are clean, restaurants of high quality and there's always something to do. The Double tree hotel embodies these qualities. From my room 9 with a small balcony, I could see the harbor and the masts of the Star of India, a sailing ship from the early 20th century. The location of the hotel, just a few blocks from the Little Italy Quarter, easy walking distance to the Harbor and gaslight district make it a great base of operations for a San Diego visit. The light rail system is close by so there's little to want for. The hotel staff is friendly and attentive, beds are comfortable and the rooms a decent size. a good value overall. They also have a large pool and Jacuzzi that are perfect after a long day. The breakfast buffet was extensive and reasonably priced, but there are a few little places for a light breakfast or lunch in the area as well for the budget minded. The only caution is if you have a car and need to use the garage. Try not to panic when you see the narrow, walled ramps between the levels. it OK for a Fiat 500, but if your driving an American midsized car or larger, you may have to plan your maneuvers more carefully; Think landing on the deck of one of the Aircraft Carriers in the harbor if you want to avoid a "body rash"on your car. On street parking is not an option as its not allowed overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geeseland
Reviews.Content: You can tell the building itself is old, but the rooms and lobby are up to date. The room was nice and the view was also pretty good. The lobby is a bit small for my taste, and was crowded. It is close to Little Italy which is a plus. Nice clean property.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location! Close to Little Italy, The Harbor, and The Gaslamp Quarter. The room had free internet which we appreciated. The room was comfortable with a great view of flights landing at Lindbergh airport. Our only complaint was the narrow parking garage. We were warned in other reviews but experienced 1st hand how narrow it really was. When exiting the ramp was so narrow we had an accident causing noticeable damage to a rental car. Other than that, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “just so-so”
Reviews.Author: sonic1us
Reviews.Content: Little italy is a fun casual area with lots to see and walk around little neighborhood. Many food places to pick from. The smoke alarm went off and the intercom in everybodies room said to take the stairs and leave the building. We noticed the fire trucks shortly afterwards. We called the front desk and they won't tell us what it was but we were to leave asap. After we left the building at 10pm we had to walk all the way back to the front door to be let in. Service was terrible and no explanation was given. The shuttle to the airport wouldn't wait for my husband who was exactly 4 mins late. We had to go by cab to the airport. For what we paid and for what we got it was not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Always An Adventure At Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: SteelBeach
Reviews.Content: Let's see - I have stayed at a DTree that looked like an old motel, one that looked like a Holiday Inn, one that looked like a Golf Resort, and one that looked like the Waldor Astoria. This DTree is a massive hi-rise just a few blocks from Downtown...and it was fine. People were very nice, the restaurant was good, the rooms were clean and small. No earthy idea why you need a balcony 20 floors up -- but I had one. It was very close to the airport (quick shuttle or $10 cab ride) and in a very quiet residential neighborhood. Little Italy was about three blocks away -- lots of restaurants. I thought the price was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but some noise overflow from adjacent rooms”
Reviews.Author: toastytravels
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the rooms and the location of the hotel for a quick overnight stay. The only (and kind-of significant) downside was some apparent plumbing issues or something that made any water use from the adjacent room to cause my bathtub to gurgle loudly like a bathtub volcano was about to explode. This was mostly bothersome because it woke me up at 3:30 in the morning. While the shower was being used in the room next door, my bathtub was threatening to erupt the whole time. Don't know if this was a hotel-wide issue or if it was just our block of rooms, but it was frustrating and noisy. Otherwise, my stay was OK, albeit sleep-depriving, which I guess could be a pretty big issue. The bed was ok, but not the best i've ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: cadagility
Reviews.Content: I booked a king-size suite for a conference. My husband and son came along and they were going to sight-see while I worked. The suite was a good size, but there was no door and therefore no privacy between the master bedroom area and the living room sofa bed area. My husband liked how large the room was and the quality of the furnishings. The bathroom featured a jacuzzi tub with a shower head looming over the tub - it didn't look safe and showering was awkward at best. There was one small sink and for a large bathroom, it could have been two sinks or a larger sink for the space. There was one bathrobe in the closet and there should have been two. There was no refrigerator, but we made a call to the front desk and one was brought up. My son had brought his Xbox to play games in the evenings. The TV uses a closed circuit which means we had to hack the TV in order for him to get a channel to play on and he couldn't connect to XBox Live because the internet service has not been set up for game play. If you bring a DVD player with you when you travel, you also would not be able to play DVDs on the flat screen TV unless you know how to hack it. We did call an engineer in and he was pretty useless. We knew more about what was going on than he did. My son was extremely disappointed, to say the least. It appears that the hotel expects you to pay for movies and does everything to discourage anyone who brings in their own equipment for entertainment. The parking garage is a bit stressful to drive in, the passageways are quite narrow and if you are driving anything larger than a sub-compact, be extremely careful. I am not sure if the structure meets code. We swam in the pool and used the jacuzzi (located on the fifth floor). Both were clean and in good working order. The room was extremely noisy due to the HVAC system. We were kept awake by the air conditioning system from the room next to us. My husband and I aren't used to a lot of ambient noise at night, so it doesn't take much to keep us up. Some people might not have been bothered by it. We ate in the restaurant (located off the lobby) one evening. Prices were reasonable for a hotel restaurant in the $10 to $15 range for entrees. Food was decent, but nothing worth raves. My husband ordered a burger. My son ordered a chicken sandwich. I had a fresh beet salad. The fresh beets came from a can and the walnuts overwhelmed the rest of the ingredients, but the portion size was large. Service was uneven. Our water was filled regularly, but the food service was slow - especially since the room was less than half-full. The actual location of the hotel was unremarkable. There are no restaurants or shopping close by and we had to drive to the convention center due to the distance. Last time I had attended a conference here, I had stayed at the Hilton next door to the Convention Center and it was a better choice, but that Hilton was a lot more expensive for a suite. For a two room - king size bed and sofa bed, it was $242 per night plus an additional $20 for parking our rental car. There was no breakfast included, although you can get fresh cookies daily and a US Today. Next time, since we had to drive to get anywhere any way, I might pick an Embassy Suites away from the downtown or convention area. I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A huge THANK YOU!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: First I want to thank the staff at the Doubletree Downtown. On my second day in San Diego I lost my wedding ring and became hysterical. The housekeeper Ana found it and turned it in to lost and found. I am eternally grateful!! My room had a great view of the downtown skyline. The room was quiet and yet you could see the huslte and bustle going on down on the streets. Im a very picky when it come to fitness centers in hotel rooms and this particular hotel had Precor weights and thats a huge plus for a fitness enthusiast like me. The breakfast buffet was excellent and service with a smile in the morning goes a long way. Roy at the front desk was helpful as usual (ive stayed here twice in the past). Dining in Downtown (Gaslamp District) has become too crowded so I ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and was pleased with their new menu.

Reviews.Title: “Warm cookie takes the biscuit..tough parking”
Reviews.Author: Waidesworld
Reviews.Content: At check-in they give you a warm cookie...wonderful idea. It was a decent room, with a balcony so you could watch the traffic coming into town. While close to the airport, I never heard a plane. I'd have preferred to be closer to downtown as my choice of food wasn't too good, especially after a long day where I didn't want to travel too far. The pool area didn't contain towels so I wasn't quite sure what was happening and with no one on duty at 7:30 on Friday night, there wasn't too much options. Pool area looked abandoned. Shower was good, and the bed was comfortable. Parking was tight...very tight. I was driving an over sized rental (Durango) and negotiation of the narrow passages made for a slow ride.

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: T U
Reviews.Content: The company I work for has used the downtown DT for 2 years loyally. The sales staff is extremely friendly, helpful and professional, plus they work with all the fun things that we throw at them (Joanie/Amy/Niki are their best catchers, fyi). We get a great rate, the service is excellent and our clients are always eager to return to this downtown location, as well as snag some of their awesome fresh baked cookies from the front desk. We have referred other colleagues to them and are happy with the level of service we receive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jatl2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for the weekend getaway that I planned. In a convenient area - close to downtown, water front and I5 for traveling by car. The rooms were very nice, and as we were on the 14th floor, they offered a fantastic view of the water and city. Each room has a balcony, which was really nice in the mornings and evenings! Rooms were very clean and well appointed. Quite, and roomy. Only complaint about room was that the tub water, from shower, would not drain very fast. Otherwise, no problems at all. Be aware of the parking and cost - not bad for a large city hotel, but the parking deck in very tight and can be a little tricky to navigate in and out of. Also fills up very quickly on Saturday nights. Overall great hotel and i would recommend to anyone staying in the San Diego Area.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutLori
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree last week during a trip to San Diego. I'm in town quite a bit for work, but it was my first time at this hotel. A few things I noted: 1. Make sure you request a parking pass!! While checking in, I inadvertently forgot to mention I had a car (and was never asked). When I went to my car in the morning, there was a sign saying I didn't display a pass and my car would be towed if I didn't move it. When I ran to the desk requesting a pass they seemed like 'oh well, here's a pass.' There is no sign stating you need a pass, and I assumed you needed your key card to exit the lot but this isn't needed....They just come around and look for parking passes - so make sure you get one. 2. I stayed in 1703, which had a connecting door. Whatever you do, DON'T take this room. Can't say whether it was this specific room or whether all rooms in the hotel are like this but I could hear every breath the guy in the next room took. In fact, while laying one bed at night I found myself laughing at a joke that was on his TV! The connecting doors are paper thin and I don't think he was overly loud because I could hear every sniffle he took. Overall, it was a typical Doubletree. Staff was pleasant, but didn't go overboard and the room was clean. However, based upon my above two points, in the future, I think I'd pick another hotel that I've had better experiences at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: dctsx
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late with my review since I stayed there over a month ago, but I told myself that I'd give a good review because this place deserved it. Ray Reyes helped me out and I have no complaints whatsoever. Friendly staff and great room, would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, nice location”
Reviews.Author: GavinBridger
Reviews.Content: Found no problems with checking in. Staff were very friendly. Room on the 18th floor was nice and clean and wireless internet was fast. Food was very good. Short walk to the gaslight quarter and sea front. Would definately stay stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms,great location and great rate too,no complaints,really. My new home when in San Diego. The lady at the front desk was a bit cold and completely unsmiley tho,I guess she was just having a bad day. Other than a great hotel and I look forward to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the front desk staff?”
Reviews.Author: Turtle9275
Reviews.Content: Service at this hotel needs improvement! When registering in the early evening, we had to coax the staff out of their offices to serve us. Once available, the front desk representative was friendly and had a few recommendations for dining. While the lobby is quite contemporary and current, it appears that the rooms and floors are undergoing renovations as the entry doors have not been finished. Make certain to ask for a room that does not back up to the freeway. Their Little Italy recommendation of Filippi's was spot on in terms of food price and quality. Upon check in we inquired about booking the complimentary airport shuttle the next morning due to an early AM flight, only to find out that it was overbooked for our departure time. The front desk staff was accommodating in that they covered the cost of the taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, but just misses the mark.”
Reviews.Author: MondayAlready
Reviews.Content: I want to like this hotel. The room was neat, clean and updated. The wireless was free and effortless. The staff was polite and attentive. The hotel location is good. A farmer's market is just outside its doors on the Saturday we were there. It sits, however, on the off-ramp of the 5 freeway. It's on the side of the freeway where you can walk to Little Italy and the Gaslamp District easily ... as opposed to, for instance, the Holiday Inn. In fact, being on the off-ramp didn't pose any real inconveniences, except that when we exited the freeway, we drove past the hotel before we started reading address numbers to find it. To have a hotel so close to the freeway is a little off-putting, but did not break my experience. The knocking sounds that we heard throughout the night from the bathroom pipes is what tipped the scales for me. My husband reported the plumbing problems to the front desk and they said they would look into it, but I think it's just something that happens regularly. My husband was so disturbed by it that he reported it again to an employee in the hallway on our check out day. I said, "Why say anything now? We're leaving?" He said he wanted them to know that they had a problem and didn't want the next guest to encounter it. The employee responded by saying that they were working on the plumbing in the entire hotel and hadn't gotten to our floor yet. Lastly, we were attending a seminar that weekend in a ballroom inside of the hotel. At one point, the workers were really loud behind the walls. They quieted when someone in our group went back there to alert them. Otherwise, we had a great time in downtown San Diego. The hotel does not leave a bad taste. I would say it delivers on quality, but the hiccups in the experience make it just miss the mark for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, although some noise”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree by Hilton Downtown is what you'd expect from a 333 room, high-rise hotel - business centric and functional. The rooms are clean, the amenities are nice without being too frilly and the WiFi actually works (in the rooms, but not, for some reason, in the restaurant). The rooms also have balconies that are dizzying. After a really long flight from the East Coast, I slept like a baby. There is fair amount of noise from passing trains and planes, so light sleepers might have trouble, but it was no issue for me. And that warm welcome cookie just hit the spot! More on our trip to San Diego: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/search/label/San%20Diego

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag: Sometimes Great & Sometimes Not”
Reviews.Author: Tax_Counsel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Doubletree hotel during November 2011 after booking a package including breakfast and tickets to the San Diego Zoo. In my opinion this hotel is definitely a mixed bag: Some aspects were great while others werenâ€™t. Rooms: Our room was large enough and had been recently renovated. It featured 40â€� flat panel televisions, new furniture, and a new bathroom vanity. In most respects it felt like a modern hotel. That modern feel did not, however, extend to the bathtub or the doors. The doors were not replaced or painted during the renovationâ€”they looked as though they were 20 years old, as did the bathtub. Personnel: Every staff member that we encountered was friendly and helpfulâ€”especially in the restaurant. Each time we had a question or special request we were more than satisfied by the kind attention we received. Restaurant: This hotel has one restaurant which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Unlike most of our other trips we ate breakfast and dinner on site. The breakfast buffet, which featured all the usual fare, was competitively priced when compared to other San Diego hotels. Dinners were priced closer to traditional hotel pricing (a poor value). Our only complaint regarding the restaurant concerned the lighting in the high-ceiling areas. Those fixtures used cheap fluorescent lights which gave me a headache and reduced the visual appeal of their food. The booth seating, under an overhang, had incandescent light fixturesâ€”without the headache. Lastly, other reviewers have commented on the narrowness of the parking garage. Although I was skeptical I now believe them. The minivan we rented barely fit on the ramps between floors, and the parking spots themselves were narrower than the ramps. Making this situation worse were the reserved parking spots for hotel staff. It seemed that the widest and easiest to access spots on every floor of the garage were reserved for the hotelâ€™s employees or managers. In my book itâ€™s bad show to put the staff above your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Quirks”
Reviews.Author: mrfargo2
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference in San Diego and my travel agency booked me at the downtown Doubletree. The hotel is located close to the airport and Little Italy but a bit removed from the convention center area. That wasn't a huge deal since a taxi to the conference was only $8.00. Got a room on the 19th floor which had a gorgeous view of the harbor. However, the hotel was inconsistent in a number of ways. First, the Internet service was really, really poor. As it turns out, you had to ask the front desk for the "upgraded" service for it to be useful for anything but basic email. No one ever told me this nor was any in-room information provided in this regard. Asked them to open up the bandwidth for me and was told they'd do so, but never got anything faster than 0.4 Mbps. I had a number of hours available before the conference started each day but could not get much work done due to the painfully slow connection speeds. Next, the plumbing in this facility was very strange. Anytime an adjoining room (or room above you) used their sink, shower or toilet, my plumbing made loud gurgling noises for about five minutes afterwards. Does this even meet local building codes? I have stayed in hundreds of hotel rooms and this was a first. Speaking of adjoining rooms, the privacy between rooms was non-existant. Honestly, I could hear every single word being spoken on the phone by the person in the next room. This was creepy and definitely is something that the hotel needs to fix and do so soon. The person next to me was obviously staying there by herself. I can't imagine what else I might have heard in other circumstances! The location was acceptable. The room was clean. The front desk and restaurant personnel were friendly. The housekeeping was perfect. Nevertheless, I give the hotel only an average rating due to some very basic things that are currently being overlooked by hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Rock's!”
Reviews.Author: arlina C
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego, CA. for a Family Reunion. I needed a place to stay for a couple of nights. I opted for the Doubletree San Diego. Well, I made the right choice. As I arrived I was greeted with a warm smile and a delicious warm cookie! Finally, got the key's to my room on the 21st. I entered the room it smelled CLEAN! You know that housekeeping does their job! Mind you I have bad allergies. I've been to hotel rooms at 4 star hotels, that as i enter the room, I immediately start to sneeze because of the dust! Well, not here, oh no not a speck of dust! The bed was nice and tucked in with very clean linen's. Went into the resstroom and not one water spot nor a single strand of hair. I wanted to take a long shower and needed extra towels. So, I called housekeeping directly. A very sweet voice answer's the phone and say's her name is "Maria and how could she help me?" I asked for more towels and within 5 minutes I had not only more Bath towels she also sent up more hand towels! The very friendly housekeeper asked if I needed anything else, to not hesitate and call them back. I called "Maria" to thank her, She said they were there to serve our need's and request. All in all my 3 days there were truly peaceful. Something as simple as a wine opener Maria had it sent up by her amazing staff. I think we should all appreciate the housekeeping department more often and thank them for all their hard work! Please, don't forget the compensate them for their services. Thank Maria and all the housekeeping staff at the Doubletree San DIego! You all deserve a huge raise!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: wnwmike
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 4 nights over the Thanksgiving holidays visiting our daughter! The hotel is near everything. Gave us a nice spacious room on the 20th floor with Bay & City views and had no noise problems at all. Beds & linens are wonderful & outstanding pillows! They have a good breakfast buffet and the staff is very friendly throughout the hotel. Free internet and we even had free parking (A $22/Day Savings)! And don't forget about the chocolate chip cookies for every day of your stay and the details of fan arranged tissues and towels. A really nice hotel in a Great area at a Great rate. We will definitely stay here again! As for the lower reviews...You are not paying for a 5 Star hotel here so why expect one....If you need more than a nice size very clean room then book a suite....& how can you ever rate even a 5 Star Hotel (We've stayed in a few) on room service for a dining experience....even when some are lavish there is no comparison to the high end restaurants of the 5 Stars! Try to imagine ordering 2 full meals at a cost of $400 from the French Laundry in Napa Valley on a take out basis!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Bangladesh
Reviews.Content: For the price that you pay, this is a decent hotel. Has good location next to I5, Airport, Little Italy. The rooms are small, but clean and well kept. Junaita was good at fixing the rooms properly and on time. The check in and check out was fast. Beds and pillows are very good. Room service food was horrible and very pricey. Nothing else to eat at 10 PM in the hotel, but it was thanksgiving. The pool was a Joke. Views were ince.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport and freeway”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport, and you can hear the occasional rumble of airplanes. I was surprised I didn't hear it more often, but we were there on Thanksgiving Day. You can also hear the freeway noise, but it was not bothersome. Parking is $22/day. Other than that, this is the usual Doubletree: clean, good cookie. The toilet paper is located behind the toilet, and I had to lean awkwardly back to reach it. A shorter, older person would have had a hard time reaching it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sofieah
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a night out for my husband's birthday. It wasn't quite in the downtown location that we had expected and the exterior looked as though it may be an older, rundown hotel but when we walked in we were pleasantly surprised with the remodeling. The rooms were perfect, very spacious, updated interior and with a nice balcony to see the city. Love the warm cookies and the comfortable bed. For the price, it was a great deal for us and worth having to take a $5 cab to the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mogcyh
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more rundown Doubletree I've stayed at. The lobby feels as though it was decorated in the 80s with glass etageres lit with neon lights, leather chairs that suggest you should be wearing a Don Johnson a la Miami Vice bright blue suit. Having said that the rooms themselves are what one would expect of a doubletree. The bathroom had all the accoutrements one needs. The Welcome chocolate chip cookie still warm was perfect with a cup of in-room coffee. The balcony attached to the room is large enough for two chairs and a table for a nice morning breakfast. The view of course, is a bit lacking, as it looks over Highway 5. Location is less than central, requiring a good 20 minute walk to the Gaslamp district and even trying to figure out how to get to the hotel is difficult, if one does not have a GPS to guide through each turn (one wrong turn and you're on the wrong side of the highway). While getting a cab to and from the hotel is not difficult, given the number of hotels available, we'll likely stay elsewhere next time. Lastly, for some reason the faucet plumbing was faulty and everytime you washed your hands, you'd hear an amplified echo of water dripping through different pipes for the following 5 minutes. We did call to complain about it but were told there were no quickfixes. Given how late it was, we did not want to move rooms and obviously just stopped using the faucet.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, narrow parking structure”
Reviews.Author: justin44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly priced. The rooms are a decent size and fairly well appointed. The lobby is small but fashionable. The best part of the hotel is that its 4 blocks from Little Italy, providing plenty of dining and drinking options within a short walk. The view is also excellent, and each room has a small balcony which is a bonus that most hotels dont have. The rooms have decent bathrooms and are very clean. Its a pleasant hotel but is older, and its hard not to notice the age. This isn't a camplaint, just an obseravation. Also, the parking garage is abysmally small, especially for $22/night. Any wide vehicle will not be able to park here! Booked this hotel through Hotwire for a saturday night. Get a good price but was stuck with 2 beds instead of a king sized bed. (Their Queen beds seems more like Twin size) The front desk said they were full for the night but I doublechecked their website and it showed availability for the same night with King Sized rooms. A greedy move on their part.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant business-traveler hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: If you have business in downtown San Diego or are there to see the array of popular sights that are scattered around town, it's a pleasant hotel in a reasonably central and walkable location. I like the hotel; we were comfortable there, and I have absolutely no complaints, but I see it more as a normal business hotel than something vacationers would be dazzled by. Vacationers might prefer some of the properties along Harbor Drive (or the Gaslamp district for those who like the Gaslamp district, which is not everybody's thing.) The turns and lanes of travel in the Doubletree self-parking garage were extremely tight.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: CharleneA
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good service or a good meal. We stayed for two nights and our room was not cleaned after we left our room even though the maid was still on our floor. We had breakfast and lunch at the restaurant and had to go to the hostess each time to pay our bill. In addition, I ordered a steak sandwich and the steak was burnt and the sandwich was mostly bread.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Doubletree Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Karin-ATL
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay for a recent business trip at the Doubletree in downtown San Diego a few weeks ago. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful -- they really went out of their way to be warm, friendly, and eager to provide any requested information or assistance. The restaurant and bar personnel were equally attentive, and the buffet breakfast had plenty of low calorie (and otherwise) options. My one suggestion would be to make sure that -- if you like your room to be VERY quiet (like I do), be sure to ask for a space on the other side of where the freeway is located. Although I was on an upper story (14th floor), the sound of car traffic stil came through my closed windows. I got used to it, but it took a night or two. The hotel's only a few blocks walk from San Diego's Little Italy, where there are a LOT of restaurant choices. You can also take an easy 5 minute stroll to the streetcar and catch an easy ride on San Diego's excellent trolley system to get to Old Town. The location might seem a little scary. (I had a few moments of being concerned during the 15 min. walk from the closest Coaster train stop and passed a couple of groups of homeless people, as well as noticing several bail bondsmen, since the location isn't far from the San Diego jail.) But absolutely no one bothered me and, during the three days I was there, no one ever approached me. I did a lot of walking (the official conference hotel was about a mile or so away, and I always took advantage of the beautiful weather and used my feet to go back and forth), and never had a problem. I also walked quite a bit after dark (albeit with a woman colleague), going to and returning from late-ish dinners, and we never felt at risk. I would definitely stay here again if I return to San Diego, thanks to the friendly staff, good location and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place/location”
Reviews.Author: Tipflex
Reviews.Content: I am A Hilton Diamond memeber, so stay in a lot of Hiltons. When in San Diego, I often opt for the Doubletree. It upholds the high Doubletree standard. Excellent alternative to the Gaslamp District and easy walk to San Diego's Little Italy - with its great Italian restaurants and Princess Pub/Grille. Staff is extraordinarily friendly and the rooms everything you could ask for. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better service”
Reviews.Author: brenda p
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is really nice, but the service and hospitality were amazing. Only a $6 cab ride to the Gaslamp district. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the view was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Powersmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after driving to San Diego from Vegas. What a great hotel!! Check in was very easy and there were no isues. We got a room on the 22nd floor and had an amazing view of the airport and runway (this is great if your into planes). Although we booked a king bed, those rooms were taken and we were given 2 small beds, but to be honest this was not a problem. The room was very clean and the bathroom was great. No problems at all with this hotel or room. The hotel is also very close to some great resturants as well as San Diego Zoo, so for the price you cant really go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and noisy”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes when I checked in here, but ended up disappointed. Check-in was quick and easy and my room was fine at first glance. I was on the interstate/airport side, which gave me concern, but thankfully, was not as noisy as it could have been. If you are a light sleeper, do not get a room on this side. My bigger problem was when I was awoken around 5am due to the noisy pipes. Anytime anyone around me took a shower, the pipes squeaked. Then, as if it couldn't get any worse, there seemed to be some clogged pipes and I could hear the sound of water slowly draining (glug, glug, glug) from a nearby (above?) shower. nothing ever came up into my tub thankfully, but it sounded like it was about to. Other two problems in the bathroom - mold - eww!!!! and i had trouble getting the water to turn off in the shower after using - it just dripped. apparently the housekeeping couldnt get it off either since it was STILL dripping when i returned to my room late that night. Housekeeping also left a dirty rag in the bathroom. Bed was comfy and lots of feather pillows. TV was not even plugged into the cable when I first tried to turn it on. I did get room service - delivery was quick, food was decent. Food at the breakfast buffet was pretty good. Gym is very nice - several cardio machines with their own tvs, some free weights, small weight machine and some pilates equipment. The pool was tiny, but there was a nice deck that the gym looked out on - lots of lounger type chairs. Parking at the hotel is in a garage that is very narrow - be careful if you are driving a bigger car/suv. Overall, this doubletree was just average - I probably will not stay here again, which is too bad because you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent guest service”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I checked into the Doubletree in downtown San Diego on a Saturday for a week of business. The first person we we fortunate enough to encounter was Ray at the front desk. Ray checked us in and let us know exactly what we needed to know each time we asked a question. I am a gold member with Hilton and had asked to be upgraded into a suite to make it easier for my co-worker and I to work in the evenings (and watch football over the weekend!). Even though there was not an upgrade available right away, Ray kept on it and got me into the suite in time for work (ie: football) on Sunday. Ray continued to be our go to guy for the rest of our week. He was invaluable to is and I could see that the entire staff was always working toward making everyone's stay the best possible.

Reviews.Title: “WonderPlace to stay”
Reviews.Author: miyoyo
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides excellent service. Nice rooms, nice comfortable beds. Its extremely easy to get to and close to all downtown features, events. The food at the restaurant is also very delicious and I really love the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, quiet, good nights sleep and good breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Clparker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our weekend get away to San Diego. Walking distance to Little Italy. Just a short walk to the baseball stadium. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much to love about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thruthegarden
Reviews.Content: Whether you like or dislike this hotel seems to hinge on what each reviewer's particular needs or pet peeves. We just spent one week at the Doubletree Downtown. We were looking for location, cleanliness, comfort, and value. The hotel more than met our needs and expectations. The location is excellent: steps away from the Little Italy entertainment district, close to the trolley stop, a quick walk to the bayfront, and about 7 short blocks to the Gaslamp District. We enjoy walking, and found that we could walk to Balboa Park and the Zoo in about a half hour (North on 1st Street, turn right on Laurel which turns into El Prado, and there you are.) Our room was bright, large, and spotlessly clean. The staff member that checked us in fulfilled our request to have the best view available (see attached photos). The balcony was really a bonus and we used it frequently. Housekeeping staff were pleasant and responsive. The room was always clean and made up before we returned in the afternoon. The plumbing does make some strange, and sometimes loud, sounds, but we found that if we kept the bathroom door shut, it didn't bother us. Some of the wood furniture is older but not in bad shape. Chairs were new and comfortable. We had a new flat screen tv. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. We didn't have any problems with noise although the other rooms around us were occupied. We didn't find this neighborhood to be creepy, and felt comfortable walking around at night because so many people were out walking or eating at sidewalk cafes. The hotel staff were mostly very outgoing and helpful. The hotel van driver that came for us at the airport was very informative and oriented us to the neighborhood on the way to the hotel. We did not use the parking garage so i cannot comment on that aspect. We got an excellent rate for our stay and feel that we got a great deal for our money. I definitely would recommend the Doubletree Downtown and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “thanks to all at Doubletree Downtown”
Reviews.Author: m m
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 day stay here and the room and everyone here was great...the suite was beautiful and very quiet considering you are right in the heart of town,, San Diego is a great city and if we get a chance to return again we will be booking at this Doubletree...P.S. thanks to Eric for the cookies

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerUpland
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotel San Diego Downtown is a very nice facility. My wife and I stayed on September 10 & 11, 2011 to attend the many events taking place in Little Italy and the Art Walk Festival down on the bay. This facility is very clean and the front desk personnel were very accommodating. Our room was very lovely and we had a beautiful view of the city. The bed was very comfortable and we had a peaceful night of rest. The hotel is just a few short blocks to Little Italy with terrific restaurants and gift shops. Its about a 20 minute walk from the hotel to Convention Center area. The walking time gave us a chance to see some of the many beautiful art galleries, restaurants and gift shops in the Gas Lamp District. After reading the other "reviews" of this hotel we would puzzled will all the fuss to park. The parking seemed more than adequate for a mid size vehicle. Although we did notice several large Pick-Up trucks and large vans in the parking stalls that were able to maneuver just fine. The location, accommodations, and cleanliness was perfect for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected (from reviews)”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right off the freeway in DT San Diego. Thanks to the tips on this website we requested a high floor facing away from the freeway. We were treated to wonderfu views of DT and the harbor. Enjoyed standing out on the balcony and soaking in the views. Pros: Low price (through Priceline bidding process), friendly staff, free internet, wonderful views, very short walk to little Italy (great food!), short drive to gaslamp, old town, and all attractions (Seaworld, Zoo, Petco park, etc.). Cons: $22/night parking, strange parking garage lay-out (use the mirrors they provide or else you literally can't see around the ramps). Other: Average sized rooms. A/C was adequate... but never got the room quite as cool as I'd like. Prefer room with 2Q (instead ot 2 doubles)... but this is not unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, jewelry left in room returned!”
Reviews.Author: CaliPalosVerdes
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter and grandson there for a 3 day weekend. We especially enjoyed the delicious breakfasts and the location that is so convenient to the zoo and other Balboa Park attractions. We were especially impressed with the response from the hotel management when our daughter left several expensive jewelry items in her hotel room. When she got home and called the Doubletree, the staff located the jewelry quickly, and it was shipped to our daughter by mid week. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sucessfull Membership Trip”
Reviews.Author: Debbie R
Reviews.Content: The New England Air Museum provides trips each year to our membership. This years destination was San Diego and through the San Diego Convention & Visitors Bureau the Doubltree Hotel Downtown came to my attention. Working with the sales staff planning my trip was great, as they gave us a great rate including a hot breakfast buffet each morning. Upon our arrival, I was delighted with the hotel staff and cleanliness of our accommodations. There was always plenty of staff to answer questions and provided transportation when needed. As an aviation Museum, my group was pleased that their balconies overlooked the airport, but airport sounds could not be heard at night. The location was perfect for our group to walk to Little Italy for dinner each evening; a couple blocks to the trolley; and a straight shot to the waterfront. I was very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Teddy G
Reviews.Content: I took my family down to the San Diego area and stayed at the Doubletree for a few days and had a blast. This hotel was located in a great area, was clean and the staff was very helpful. I would recxommend this place to any one heading to San Diego!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all.......Worth the price paid on Priceline, but no more!”
Reviews.Author: ScottySunDevil
Reviews.Content: I'll start this off by saying that I very rarely have negative reviews for hotels. Not even sure if I've left a negative review on Trip Advisor previously. In reading some of the other reviews, it's clear that they've redone some floors. Floor 15 (1520 specifically) is definitely not one of them. Here's some general feedback from the hotel: 1) Wallpaper peeing off 2) Sink in bathroom didn't drain- literally filled up to the top 3) Shower head needs replacement, water doesn't come out well 4) Shower curtain really gross 5) A/C condensate dripped onto carpet drenching carpet 6) Pretty ghetto looking balcony, not even sure what it's use is, except maybe for smokers? Good news is that you can park on the street for free on the weekends......beats the $22 they were asking for. Pool area started off looking like a very nice space when you walk outside, only to find: 1) A significant sized area (on floor 5) with a very small pool 2) Only 10 chaise lounges (there are some outdoor sofas for those who like that) 3) Really nice bar with some stools and beers on tap, but no one working there! 4) No towels at the pool (had to go into the gym to get towels) Again, I'm not someone that traditionally complains. My wife and I are 31 and go to hotels to sleep and shower and don't need much at all. This hotel just left a lot to be desired, even for just an overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Second time we have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: LeeCarroll01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We stayed here for the San Diego Comic Convention. Right beside wonderful restaurants in Little Italy. Nice walk to many attractions and the shopping mall. Staff very helpful. Minor plumbing problem in our room on our last day which they sorted within a couple of hours. Free pickup and return to the airport. Our hotel of choice in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andres C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my cousins when they visited me and my family, and I must say that the rooms looked great. Besides the great view looking over downtown, the rooms were super clean. My uncle even said that he has never stayed in a room where you can smell the freshness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FannyIllinois
Reviews.Content: Being so close to the Pacific coast helped us a lot.Every morning we went walking to the harborside.Added attraction was the close proximity to Gas lamp quarter,tram lines and trams which were an interesting sight,plenty of eateries like whole of Little Italy for italian food and if you can walk more,then lots of Indian food joints,arabian food hubs are for the tourists. On the whole ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca C
Reviews.Content: This summer my family and I went on our yearly summer vacation. We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Downtown San Diego. This hotel was very clean, inviting, the staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a balcony room and the view was beautiful! The pool and spa was very refreshing and relaxing after along day of site seeing! The rooms were always cleaned very well. Every morning to start our day off right we ate breakfast at the Ariana's resturant downstairs. Service was very efficient. Overall this hotel is great! Location, service, and just all around GREAT!! I really recommend this hotel . Great for families too!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Hotel - Would return again”
Reviews.Author: KinGzCHB
Reviews.Content: After reading a bunch of the reviews I had some low expectations going in but at the end I can say that I enjoyed my stay here. The lobby was clean and the front desk staff were nice and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. My room was on the 16th floor facing the freeway. It is quite loud if you open the balcony door but if you keep it closed it shouldn't be a problem. The hotel is in a good location. Just a few blocks from Little Italy, 20 minute walk to the Convention Center and Gaslamp Quarter also within walking distance to public transit to get to the Zoo and other attractions. My only complaints were: - Parking garage is terrible - the ramp is so narrow. Use extreme caution. - The wifi was very slow and flaky in our room. - The housekeeping service was very weird and never the same. I stayed for 7 nights and the towels we got varied from 2 to 5 towels. Some days we weren't given a floor mat. Another day they took away the plastic liner from our shower curtain. We received two water bottles on the third night but never received any after that. Some nights we had 3 pillows on our bed, others we had 5. Nothing serious to complain about but just odd. Overall, I had a good stay and would return/recommend this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb guest service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: allovertraveler1
Reviews.Content: I was less than thrilled when my vacation was cut short and I was forced to attend a week long training seminar at my company's head quarters in San Diego. I usually stay at Marriott brand when I travel on business, but I was put up at the Double Tree Hotel near the Gas Lamp district because it was close to where I needed to be and available. I checked in late at night, but I was greeted in the most friendly and accommodating way. My check in was done quickly and efficiently and I was given the most delicious cookies. The housekeeping staff was top notch and kept my room just the way I like it. I signed up for Hilton Honors and I can honestly say that Double Tree in Downtown San Diego persuaded me. I be back and will recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with great service”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoPlains
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect because some of the reviews said the place was older. It is a little bit worn, but it is comfortable, and the view from the balcony was lovely. Everybody was very helpful. Free Internet access and printing. It is located near Little Italy, the Maritime Museum, Anthony's Restaurant, and a trolley stop. We opted to try using public transportation and it worked great. We could trolley to Old Town and grab a bus to the beach. We took a trolley to the baseball park and back. When we were short of time we grabbed a taxi. Way cheaper than the cost of a car rental and parking downtown. The only complaint we had was that the drain in the shower was slow, and there was some gurgling in the middle of the night. Not a lot, but it woke us up once. Overall though, we were very happy with our room. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star was that it wasn't perfect. That said, I would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but watch out for the ramp!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the location was good (although I think after visiting that I would have preferred the Gaslamp location). There were lots of places, including Little Italy, within walking distance. We were in town to visit the Zoo and it was an easy drive from the hotel. The rooms were well kept, if not extremely new, and the beds were comfy. The parking ramp, however, was treacherous. Be VERY CAREFUL negotiating the turn to get to the upper levels of the ramp. It's nearly (but not quite) impossible. Our first try resulted in a huge dent/scratch on our older-model Chrysler Concorde. I'm just glad we decided to drive our old car rather than to get a rental. I really don't think they should feel comfortable charging $20/night to park in that ramp. I also felt the hotel staff was a little less than helpful. Not rude, just sort of indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “OUR LUGGAGE WAS STOLEN OUT OF OUR ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: SS220
Reviews.Content: OUR LUGGAGE WAS STOLEN RIGHT OUT OF OUR ROOM!! I will not give this hotel any stars because the management is horrible. During my stay on July 16th-17th, My luggage was STOLEN right out of my hotel room! The manager on duty did not even have the decency to come up to our room when we discovered the theft. The General Manager was not on site, but even after she came to the hotel the next morning, she did not find it her priority to come see us. I had to go down to the lobby at least six times to get answers from the staff. Extremely disappointed with the experience. They issued our key cards to another guest, and they don't have working security cameras, so the police were not able to get any leads on who stole our luggage! When we asked about reimbursement for the hotel stay, the General Manager deflected our request to their insurance company, saying only they can reimburse you. They would not even provide us any contact information for corporate. When we said to the GM that this is your fault, her immediate response was "Wait, its not my fault, I wasn't even on site when this happened!" Any person that has worked in a customer service oriented industry, knows that as a Manager, anything that happens in your establishment, IT'S YOUR FAULT! We are still fighting with the hotel's insurance company, which only wants to reimburse us a depreciated value of our belongings, which would not help us to replace almost a $12,000 loss (laptops, ipods, dslr camera, jewelry, etc). THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff, def better options for parking, location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. It wasnt anything special but the staff was extremely friendly and was clean. The parking is a complete rip off at $30 a night. I actually found parking on the street near by the hotel for free. All street/metered parking is free in the city of San Diego on weekends. The hotel was in downtown but still isnt the closest walk to all the main tourist attractions. I got a great rate through priceline name your price, so I thought it was an excellent deal. Also has free wifi and depending on the room you may receive a great view of the city of SD. If I go back to San Diego I probably would stay elsewhere but if I got another great deal like I did I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Downtown San Diego and Airport”
Reviews.Author: quequedub
Reviews.Content: Just one overnight here between flights. The hotel is conveniently located downtown, just a couple of miles from the airport, so it's a really quick hop between the two. The public spaces are updated and felt modern and comfortable. The lobby was a little dark because of the way the lobby is set in the building's footprint. But the check-in desks had a chic up-to-date feeling. There was a water feature in the lobby, which I rather liked. The restaurant and bar areas also felt very updated and were nice. The rooms were basic: clean, comfortable, and okay. A really nice bonus was the balcony and spectacular view of the skyline and water. It wasn't really big enough to do anything other than just step out for a look, but that's a big plus over what most hotels offer in the way of a balcony. One odd thing, though, was the room's coffee station, which was dead in the way. If you get up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom, well, watch out, because it's very easy to trip over it. Also, the bathroom could use more light, but I find most hotel bathrooms suffer from this same problem. And, the room never really did get cool enough for my tastes, no matter how low I set the thermostat. The hotel does offer a shuttle to and from the airport. While it is a nice amenity, and one of the main reasons I chose this Hilton property, it was spotty. Upon arrival into the airport, I called after I collected my bags. It took twenty minutes or so before it turned up. On the way back out, I was told that it departed every fifteen minutes. This wasn't my experience at all. I waited for about 25 minutes before the front desk finally called--and paid for--a taxi. Kudos to the hotel for offering to foot the bill for the taxi (it was extended as an offer, without my prompting), but they really should make sure that this important amenity is toward the top of their priority list. All in all, I had a good stay. I'd return and I'd recommend to others, with the caveat to allow extra time to get to the airport and to verify for certain what the actual schedule is--and not just what it's supposed to be--when you're going to leave.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, VFM, well located, super cookies on arrival”
Reviews.Author: takama
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a conference in san diego convention centre for 4 days in june 2011. excellent welcome, nice staff, better breakfast than most other hotels this category in usa super hot cookies on arrival, wish thry gave them out daily. rooms look jaded but are adequate. lot of noise from passing traffic on the freeway reasonably well placed - the tram station is walking distance and gaslamp is a very short cab ride away--3-4 mins. would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: JansetMugeAltay
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms at the hotel for a group of more than hundred people. Given our keys, we went to our rooms and found out that there were people staying at the rooms that they had given us. When we told that to the reception we had the second shock. The staff at the reception desk were extremely rude and were not helpful at all (aa if it was our mistake). They told us that all the rooms were booked! It took them over an hour to sort it out and some of us had to share our rooms. It is a nice hotel with large and comfortable rooms but because of the staff I'd say I'd never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler98
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Doubletree Hotels quite often before, I was really disappointed with my stay at this hotel. I previously stayed in San Diego at the Doubletree in Hotel Circle, where my rental car was broken into and valuables stolen from the car. Disappointed enough to change my hotel in Boston from Doubletree to another hotel, for an upcoming vacation at the end of August this year. I'm not sure where to start. When checking in the lady at the front desk was very nice, after that, although I went through the lobby many times during the day (during the 4 days I was there) no one ever acknowledged that I existed. It seemed unusual for a Doubletree to have that kind of attitude. When I got to the room I took a shower and the tub didn't drain. I called the "easycare" number and told them what the problem was. I never heard anything back from anyone about the problem. And during the entire stay, I stood in foot deep water while I showered. I guess it eventually drained, because it was gone when I got back to the room at night. Also, I had to close the door to the bathroom at night because the motion sensor lights kept coming on (when no one was in there) at odd times during the night. The first night I arrived I realized that the ice machine on the 16th floor was not working. I went down to the 15th floor and filled the ice bucket, which took forever because took forever to get an elevator. I reported this to the front desk every day at least twice, but right until I checked out......the ice machine continued to be unusable. I come to San Diego once or twice every year and will make sure not to ever stay at another Doubletree in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good deal”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1980
Reviews.Content: We were able to priceline this room and got a great deal. The room was clean and nicely decorated, I wish it had a fridge but we lived without one. Just like previously stated reviews the parking garage is a nightmare, insanely narrow turns and tight spaces, was glad to be in a car. Parking was 22 a night which is typical in a city like this. But the service was good, we had no issues. The little Italy Market was right outside on Sat. Mornings and that was a lovely surprise. For the price we paid we would definately stay gain.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden away and non descript”
Reviews.Author: Jubbin55
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel. The hotel has a courtesy shuttle which lets you get dropped to the airport. I am not sure if they pick you up from the airport as well. Though the airport is quite close to the hotel. You can watch aircraft landings from the hotel balcony. The hotel itself is housed in one of the ugliest buildings in downtown San Diego. They only way you can identify it as your hotel is the double tree logo and markings on the blue awnings on the two sides of the buildings which serve as entrances. Good 1. Despite an unimpressive lobby the rooms are large and comfortable with a good functional bathroom. They are clean. 2. There is free wifi in the rooms which is unusual for a hotel of this size. 3. Good quality toiletries in bathroom and coffee and tea supply. They also leave you some chocolates behind every night. 4. There is an ice/ soda vending machine on every floor with a thoughtful ice bucket in your room, Bad. 1. There is no mini- bar in the room though what I missed was the refrigerator. 2. The coffee machine did not work in my room. Though after calling up the reception it was promptly replaced. 3. The first time in a long time an instruction left at the reception for an early morning wake up call did not materialize. Though next day I figured out that the hotel has an automated system and wake up calls set up through the phone work perfectly. 4. The Hotel was a little far away from the convention centre which was were I was going. But there is a Trolley stop about 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel which can be used to reach most of San Diego by public transportation. 5. There is a large busy highway at the back of the hotel which can keep a light sleeper awake but it did not keep me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Double tree San Diego (1 mile to) downtown â€“ Not good as it should be!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Rohan
Reviews.Content: Located in the edge of little Italy, 1 mile to downtown, in the Front street, Double tree San Diego downtown is a 3 star hotel with basic facilities. Confused by the name and because of the Hilton family connection, I booked 6 expensive nights (>300 $/night including tax) last week to attend a conference. The hotel is 4-years young but the building is quiet old. Rooms are spacious and clean, furniture is old and basic, beds are ok but the mattress was moving, old model TV with good choice of channels. No mini-bar or safe in the room. No special attention to HH diamond members. Even complementary water is delivered only on request. One good thing was complimentary in-room Wi-Fi had good and unlimited connection to laptops and smart phones. I couldnâ€™t notice anything interesting, exciting or useful next to the hotel except a 24-hour bail bond office. After 10 -20 min boring walk, you can reach Westfield Horton Plaza Shopping Mall, Gas Lamp quarter and the harbor drive. Taxies drivers are reluctant to drive you there or back since it's too short distance to drive. American breakfast is served In the lobby restaurant. If you are lucky and if the waiter is in good mood and if the machine is working, you may get a cappuccino. Otherwise its only American coffee! The friendly and nice lady hanging around the lobby area (?PR manager / sorry I forgot to ask the name) was quiet helpful and tried to convince me that its one of the finest hotels in San Diego! She is kind, friendly and helpful to all the guests. Since I got a better room for a cheaper price in Hilton Gas Lamp Quarter, the hotel agreed to let me check-out two days earlier than I originally planned. (see my review on Hilton Gas Lamp Quarter too).

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room was clean the staff at reception, in the restaurant and cleaning staff were al very friendly. Walking distance to little Italy. I had a good stay and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sussiogjacques
Reviews.Content: Nice room, big enough, but not excessive. Cleanliness top marks. The free internet worked, both cable and WiFi. Recieved with a nice tepid large cookie upon arrival. The breakfast is OK; but we dined there one day. The soup was lukewarm, the steaks were overdone and the potatoes soggy. We had to visit a bar afterwards to raise our spirits. The small distance to the airport gave no noise problems. The situation on the border of "Little Italy" offered a large choice of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “parking extra”
Reviews.Author: Roundtrip23
Reviews.Content: As in most downtown hotels parking is extra in this one. (20$ I think) Besides that it's a nice place and a bargain if you get it over priceline or so. Location is absolutely ok just a couple of blocks from the GLQ (walking distance). You can get closer though. If you have a south facing room the view is fantastic and gets better the further you go up. I would not be willing to pay their full rate however, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What is it with Doubletrees Nowadays? MEDIOCRE”
Reviews.Author: xsjmjx
Reviews.Content: Yes, they have changed their logo and their brand is now mediocre. There are gorgeous Hiltons in downtown SD - the Bayfront is top notch, the Gaslamp while pricey and impossible to get into, very nice. This is another mediocre Doubletree. The location was actually decent for me being out there for work and having to travel in different directions each day - east access off of Rt. 5 South. Everything else is what I've come to expect from Doubletrees - mediocrity. In particular the breakfast eggs in this place were atrocious - some kind of fake powered egg or something. I literally gave my breakfast vouchers away. Expensive parking, but that's par for downtown SD. About a 20 min walk to the Gaslamp. You can do better! Try the other Hiltons downtown first! I might even do the Hampton Inn down the street first in the future if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hjb6916
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for 6 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great. Our room was very quiet and clean. We prepaid for our room and got a great rate and free breakfast (which was very good..hot and cold buffet). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare and Unresponsive Human Resources”
Reviews.Author: msvtaylor
Reviews.Content: Brought my teenage daughter to San Diego for Spring Break. I drive a Ford Edge 2010 and after checking in entered the parking lot. There is a sign that indicates that the height may be a problem but as I entered it was clear that the parking tunnels to enter and exit were extremely small and tight. I was able to manage to get my car in the structure but barely. Upon exit and after trying to help another guest navigate his F10 Truck so that he coudl try to back out of the parking area due to inadequate space (like me), my car brushed the side of parking garage due to not enough space to accomdate the vehicle and the tight turn. I sustained over 1,200 worth of damage. I called the hotel staff and they indicated that there is a parking issue and to have my insurance call them. I have called the suggeted HR person repeatedly with no return phone call. Bottomline - the hotel parking cannot accomodate wide or longer vehicles and damage can be sustained. Problem is, once you are in, you are stuck. The parking is poorly designed and I would strongly caution travelers from parking at this hotel. AND you have to pay $20.00 to park!! AVOID!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never been to Doubletree before”
Reviews.Author: Analisa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not as good as I hoped, older run down a bit, room was clean enough. The lobby was messy and no one even offered to help me or my daughter carry in any of our 5 bags, weird. However as for locating it was prime as shopping in this area is very good. Would i go back...no. As I stated above, never been to a Doubletree before maybe this is standard for them. Oh yes I did get charged twice for internet, so look at your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Doubletree with insane parking”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was selected as the two other Hilton properties in the area were sold out. The hotel is located in a pretty good but not amazing area. The staff were helpful. The parking here is seriously insane with incredibly narrow turns. Not sure why anyone in their right mind would design a garage like this. The rooms were pretty nice, very clean, and very spacious. The room would have been better with a flat screen TV. On another note, the printer was not working which was a pain for last minute business needs. Overall, I would once again try the other two Hilton properties before this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bobbert1312
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to see how close this hotel is to Little Italy and the Gaslamp District. A nice eight blocks walk downhill and you're in the middle of the action. The only minor issue is that the patio door did not block out all of the airport and freeway noises. But otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: fergie n
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with a lovely warm cookie and friendly staff, hardly a cue at check in time, we parked in the hotel car park wich was easy. the rooms were lovely, spaciuos, great views you are near the airport we were not woken once. there is a nice shopping centre close by and also lots of bars and resturants you also very close to mexico if you are wanting to drive there. fabulous rooftop pool and a must is san diego zoo great day out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and internet price deal were the only pluses of this DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: 2dads2kids
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to San Diego and decided to take my two pre-teen sons with me. I got a great online price deal for this DoubleTree and given the bad TripAdvisor reviews for Hampton Inn in the same area, I decided to go for it. It is NOT the best of DoubleTree offerings. The room was outdated, felt dingy, and was cramped. The front desk staff were CLUELESS about any local restaurants, directions, and other suggestions. They also were also a bit on the rude side. Alas, the immediate access to Little Italy and the trolly station made this stay worth it, as we were out of our room more than in it. Had I stayed there for business only, I would have been extremely disappointed. The internet access was BEYOND PATHETIC and the room arrangement made it impossible for working at the desk for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “I was so happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Kwilkes
Reviews.Content: I have to say we totally enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. When we arrived everyone at the front desk was happy & helpful. We booked 3 rooms and they worked hard to give us the view and the rooms on the same floor. The rooms were exceptionally clean. We actually liked the walk down to the Gas Lamp district we didn't feel it was to far at all. So over all can't say one bad thing about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3.5 Star, Narrow parking and ramps”
Reviews.Author: Snakepudding
Reviews.Content: This hotel was presented as a 3.5 star but I would suggest this is an over-rating. Narrow parking spaces and ramps resulting in not being able to park a full sized import in a slot; if you drive a full size SUV you may want to avoid this parking garage. The front desk was helpful and friendly. One of the guest elevators seemed to be shut-off. We were offered a nice location 21st floor room. Our view was mostly south but some west view. I recommend avoiding rooms facing east or north because of the freeway noise and view. The room was very well cleaned but only had a NTSC analog TV which of course resulted in a somewhat truncated image. Kudos to the housekeeping staff. Wireless internet was free; could not connect to the wired/secure internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I was hoping”
Reviews.Author: MEL1103
Reviews.Content: I'm typically pretty happy with a Doubletree, but this one wasn't spectacular. My husband, who is very laid-back and isn't into frills made mentions of not liking this hotel. As many have said, the parking is very narrow, but it's fine to navigate, just takes an extra minute or two to get in and out. The rooms were okay, but there appeared to be some plumbing or pipe issues due to the LOUD bubbling noise that occurred after running any water in our room or the nearby rooms - which affected sleep quality.
